pages.text: By soaking some gravel in various stone extracts, the extract will infuse the gravel and transform it into different types of ore.$(br2)Place up to 8 ore of the same type in the top of a Bloomery, followed by fuel like coal or charcoal, then ignite it.

Adding more fuel, fuel with higher burn times, or fuel blocks will decrease the processing time.$(br2)The process can also be sped up by placing Bellows next to the Bloomery, and standing on it to force air into the fire.$(br2)After your first ingots, you can upgrade this to a Mechanical Bellows.

Once the process is done, remove the ash with a shovel, then pull out the bloom. It's not as hot as it looks.$(br2)Place the bloom onto a Granite Anvil, and use a hammer on it to get several ingots of metals, depending on how much ore you added to the Bloomery.$(br2)The Granite Anvil will break over time, so upgrading to an Ironclad Anvil is recommended.

With iron, copper, and tin, you can now make some tools, iron buckets, some furnaces, and enter the Steam Age.$(br2)Magnetite Ore gives wrought iron & gold.$(br2)Chalcopyrite Ore gives copper & cobalt.$(br2)Cassiterite Ore gives tin & bismuth.$(p)A $(item)Refractory Kiln/$ can be used to turn your first wrought iron into normal iron.
